Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: vildan u
Reviews.Content: I have been there with my daughter and we didnt like it at all...we had to change 3 rooms in one night..first one was too small ,second one didint have electricity and heating wasnt working,third one was on the forth floor which it was impossible to sleep in with the noise was coming from the heating....it all happened in 6 hours time ,which made my 15 years old all scared and upset...next day i asked my money back and of course they werent helpfull at all which we had to move one of the 5 star hotels in the area....i would not recommend anyone at all..throwing your money in the bin is better then getting one of their rooms..

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alcidetrash
Reviews.Content: It was great stay there.location was perfect.rooms were very modern.guys at receptiom were very helpful all the time.we never had a technical or etc. during our stay.thank you guys.i will come back next year

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, but small and dark rooms, all in all 3*, not 4*”
Reviews.Author: drecus
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: PERFECT! Location, location, location! This is what sells this hotel. It is very close to Taxim Square, and very close to Istiklal street which is the major shopping area and a large pedestrian zone with lots of restaurants and cafes. From this location it is very easy to get into the other parts of the city by public transportation, from shopping areas, to the old city. From the top floor restaurant you can enjoy a perfect view of the Bosphorus and the Old city. I recommend going up there before sunrise, climb up to the top floor restaurant Skyfish (which will be closed at the time), push open the glass door and sneak inside the restaurant. Then: enjoy watching one of the most beautiful cities in the world at sunrise, along with the light show on the Europe-Asia bridge. Don't tell anyone that I told you this! Location, location... ROOMS: small, but this is not a problem if you are in Istanbul for sightseeing and shopping (which most people are). They are dark, however, and the lighting in the rooms is so awkwardly laid out and weak that there is no way that you can see enough to read, and also be careful not to lose or step on your cell-phone or camera if it ends up on the floor. I heard that some of the rooms were VERY small. This was not a problem for me because I used the hotel only for sleep-over and breakfast, most of the time I was out, sightseeing and shopping. I didn't try to run inside the room or something like that. It was big enough for its purpose. Cleanliness: OK, Size: a bit small. Lighting: completely insufficient. Wireless internet: available and free of charge, but very slow. BATHROOM: a bit small, but nicely decorated. The soaps were not replaced as often as they should have been, so I had to ask the staff for them. They didn't make any problems, but obviously needed a nudge. They cleaned the bathroom and replaced the towels regularly. BREAKFAST: very good. The Turks have an excellent and rich cuisine, and this was no exception. Food quality and freshness: very good. Staff in the restaurant: pleasant, kind, friendly, efficient. I wouldn't recommend the orange juice, though. It was obviously just a diluted syrup. Take coffee, or milk, or tea, or plain water instead. GENERAL CLEANLINESS: quite OK. STAFF IN GENERAL: nice, friendly, professional, but not over the top. Points for them: 4 out of 5. SLEEP QUALITY: fine, and as can be expected at the hotel at this location. You cannot expect a hotel located in the center of the city to be as quiet as the one in the forest in the Alps. I was so exhausted and tired every night that I slept like a baby. I was on the 3rd floor, so the noise from the disco did not bother me so much. I also understand from other reviews that the noise from a music school just across was annoying for them. Well, if you come to Istanbul, go out and enjoy this beautiful city. Do not stay in your room all day, so that noise from the music school will not bother you. If you come to Istanbul and spend your days sitting in your room, and complaining about the noise, the size of the rooms and so on, you should have stayed at home! Back to sleep quality. Beds: OK. Pillows: OK. Sheets: OK. Cleanliness: OK. PRICE: the hotel is a bit overpriced, but you tend to forget that once you start to appreciate its excellent location and an OK service and room quality and cleanliness (and very good food, of course). I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “no parking”
Reviews.Author: Stefan V
Reviews.Content: Drive one hour to get to the hotel, no parking space to park the cars are arranged in four rows of three cars bumper to bumper, spoke to the receptionist that I had to leave early, they just shrugged and said "this is the situation "We need to leave keys to move if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster, be carefull!!”
Reviews.Author: CMustafa
Reviews.Content: I have experienced a terible sitauation in this hotel, so anybody please be careful. We booked 2 rooms online and received back clear hotel confirmation. When we came recepcionist told that they have only one room and for the another room he proposed to transport us to another hotel several kilometers away. After one hour of useless discusion on our insisting his boss finally apper but trying to convience us to accept same arrangement proposed by recepcionist. When we took our laguage to go out, we were faced with another increadible matter. The boos even intended to charge our redit card if we leave his hotel, although he admit their total fail. Really something what i have never experienced. I have been many times in Turkey and enjoy hospitality in number of a their hotels. This is a something what I decided to share with a readers of Tripadvisor in order to send a warning signal to potentials gests of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location .. only stay if you don't need to sleep :)”
Reviews.Author: TerrenceDana
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location but there are MANY other hotels to choose from just as well situated to great restaurants and shopping; City Center has nice staff, rooms and linen are very clean ( if a little rough around the edges ) but weeknights the slamming doors and chairs moving around the restaurant on the 7th floor kept us awake ( don't stay on the 6th floor I guess! ); the "night club" was BOOMING on Sat. night until 1am ( at least ) which is why I'm writing this review now instead of sleeping :) Have not tried the restaurant on the roof ( SkyFsh ) but the view is really amazing. Also has a spa on site but did not try this either. Wifi was free and ( mostly ) always on strong .. So .. it's really too bad, without the noise this would have rated "4 stars" instead of just two.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Noisy Noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: margaret c
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anybody except if they were deaf, blind, but wanted a great location. The noise at night from slamming doors, restaurant / club noise, LOUD music, and chairs above in a restaurant / club was mind-boggling! The air conditioning had no room controls, and it never was cool enough. The television had limited channels, no satellite and limited cable. Sound on television was set at such a low maximum, it could not be heard even without the noise assault from all around me. I was unaware of a breakfast buffet. The room was very small, and the only positive this hotel has is its location. If you HAVE to stay here, bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Onmoon
Reviews.Content: City Center Hotel is located right in the heart of the city. The hotel has a couple of cafes, an amazing rooftop restaurant, hamam, and parking! Rooms are on the smaller side but people who travel a lot know that it is the norm for the most major city hotels around the world. Good value for the money. Walking distance to Beyoglu where many attractions can be found. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Farrukh_fromLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights. I have a conflicting feelings about this one. Location is very good, close to Taksim and Istiklal Avenue. The lobby looks decent as well. Once you go upstairs the hotel is a below average, dirty halls, unpainted walls. It looks like a dormitory halls. Breakfast is OK. The staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but possibly the smallest room in the world!”
Reviews.Author: vitting
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean hotel. Friendly staff, nice decor and very good breakfast. However stayed in what could be described as the smallest room in the world without exaggeration. Could have been roomier if they had been a bit clever when decorating - e.g hanging the lamp from ceiling instead and putting a shelf at the wall below the TV instead of using space for a table. Oh yes - it was so small that the bell boy had to step out of the room before I could get in!! :D Also to get into the amazing shower (very good!) I had to climb over the toilet as the door to the shower was attached the wrong way around... Anyway despite all that - lovely hotel. Very central location and easy to find. Can highly recommend for other people travelling on business. Apparently was a hamam in the basement, but unfortunately didnt have time to try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, inspiring views, tops for its rating”
Reviews.Author: londoner62_10
Reviews.Content: A superb location for walking around Taksim means some great restaurants and places of heritage interest / nightlife are literally a few steps away. Ok, the rooms are a little on the small side and the location means some noise at night from the nearby clubs and the daytime practising of the students at the Music School opposite (some very accomplished chopin while I was there) but the overall ambience is great, the hotel is clean and efficient and the staff are always helpful. The roof-level restaurant gives inspiring views over breakfast and the hammam in the basement is well worth a visit too. For its classification an excellent base in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but has problems with noise...”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaDR
Reviews.Content: City Center Hotel is a nice hotel... nice design... friendly stuff (not everyone speaks English, but they smile!) but has a serious problem with the noise around! When we checked in... they recommended us to stay on the first floor because on the last floor is their restaurant and they have live music and that might disturb us. Well, we avoided the live music... but we couldn't avoid the noise from the nearest cafe-bar and the college of performing arts that was right next door! During the day there was no way to rest... students were studying the piano or the violin... And studying is very very different of performing... Overall, the breakfast was good... the room was very clean but very small... and the location was perfect!!!

HotelInfo.Name: City Center Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Katip Celebi Mahallesi Billurcu Sokak No:1 Siraselviler, Istanbul 34421, Turkey
